author: Chris Morrison
title: Massive Recovery in Antarctica Sea Ice Unreported by Net Zero-Obsessed Mainstream Media - The Daily Sceptic
text:
Remember all that alarmist guff about Antarctica sea ice recording lower levels in winter a couple of years ago? Georgina Rannard of the BBC wrote a story headed ‚Äò Antarctic sea ice at ‚Äúmind-blowing‚Äù low alarms experts ‚Äò, while Clive Cookson at the Financial Times gave us his suggestion that the area ‚Äúfaces a catastrophic cascade of extreme environmental events‚Ä¶ that will affect the climate around the world ‚Äù. The scare story caravan has moved on to pastures new these days, not unrelated to the fact that at the end of 2024 the extent of sea ice in Antarctica was roughly the same as the 1981 to 2010 average. According to the U.S.-based National Snow and Ice Data Centre (NSIDC), ‚Äúthis provides a sharp illustration of the high variability of Antarctica sea ice extent‚Äù. It does indeed, and it also provides us with a classic case study of how a short-term natural variation, well understood by many scientists, is weaponised by activists in science, politics and journalism to induce mass climate psychosis with the aim of promoting the political Net Zero lunacy.
The less hysterical NSIDC would appear to be the same NSIDC that published a paper updated as recently as last July asking, ‚Äú has Antarctic sea ice hit a breaking point? ‚Äù. As the Daily Sceptic has reported in the past, Antarctica has been a bit of a disappointment to the climate cry-baby crowd since it has shown little warming for at least 70 years. ‚ÄúNow scientists are eager to know if climate change has finally caught up with Antarctica sea ice,‚Äù notes the NSIDC paper. Helpful as ever in the mission of preaching climate Armageddon, Rannard of the BBC provides us with an ‚Äúexperts say‚Äù quote: ‚ÄúWithout its ice cooling the planet, Antarctica could transform from Earth‚Äôs refrigerator to a radiator.‚Äù
Interestingly, the second author on the Rannard story was ‚Äòdata‚Äô specialist Becky Dale who subsequently enrolled for the six-month sabbatical run by the Green Blob-funded Oxford Climate Journalism Network. This is a crash course in climate catastrophisation reporting. Previous participants have been asked to write about how fruits such as mangos are less tasty than in the past due to climate change. A recent speaker has called for ‚Äúfines and imprisonment‚Äù for those expressing scepticism about ‚Äúwell supported‚Äù science.
The ‚Äômind-blowing‚Äô quote that made headlines around the world has been attributed to Dr. Walter Meier of the NSIDC. Dr Meier, reported Rannard and Dale, ‚Äúis not optimistic that the sea ice will recover to a significant degree‚Äù. At the height of the scare, Meier claimed the 2023 winter dip was far outside anything we‚Äôve seen. Again as we have reported in the Daily Sceptic , Dr. Meier seems a tad forgetful of the past work he has done on the obvious cyclical nature of Antarctica sea ice. Ten years earlier, Meier was part of a science team that unlocked the secrets of early Nimbus satellite photographs. These revealed significant Antarctica sea ice variability in the 1960s including a high in 1964, not seen again until 2014, and a low in 1966, similar to the recent dip. At the time, Meier commented that extreme ice highs and lows ‚Äúare not that unusual‚Äù.
During November and December 2024, mid to late spring in the Southern Hemisphere, the daily Antarctica sea ice loss was 140,000 square kilometres compared to 165,000 sq kms for the 1981-2010 average. By the end of December the sea ice extent was roughly around the average recorded in the 30 years to 2010. Now it seems the NSIDC is a re-convert to stressing long-term trends, noting that the 2016-2024 timeline ‚Äúis too short to definitely determine that a regime shift has occurred‚Äù.
Perhaps the NSIDC ought to mark the card of the British Antarctica Survey (BAS) team, who as late as May last year issued a press release claiming that the 2023 lows would be a one in 2,000 year event without climate change. Needless to say, this scaremongering twaddle was the product of a computer model. The model told the BAS that such ‚Äúevidence‚Äù adds to existing observational evidence ‚Äúthat the last few years‚Äô low sea ice could signal a lasting regime shift in the Southern Ocean‚Äù. More BS than BAS, the uncharitable might conclude.
Needless to say, the recent cyclical recovery in Antarctica sea ice has been ignored by mainstream media. It‚Äôs been a bad period for alarmists, coming so soon after years of record growth of coral on the Great Barrier Reef put an end to yet another profitable supply of constant alarums. Thankfully the BBC finds ever more obscure ways to keep the fast-fading Net Zero fantasy alive. Perhaps not as headline-grabbing as ice and coral, but it appears that a bumble bee has been sighted recently in Scotland. It was claimed that critters were ‚Äúnest building‚Äù and this was due to climate change . Britannica does not find such a sighting very surprising, noting that in winter when the temperature outside rises above 10¬∞C, bees will leave the hive momentarily to relieve themselves of waste. Possibly with a cheery wave and a ‚Äúback in three, going for a wee‚Äù.
All of the confusion ‚Äì designed to constantly promote Net Zero ‚Äì arises because narrative-driven commentators assign most weather and climate changes to humans adding trace amounts of a trace gas into the atmosphere. It leaves little room for explaining the role of natural variation in the changing climate. Antarctica has not warmed for at least 70 years and a recent paper found that the summer temperature had shown a dramatic 1¬∞C fall from 1977-1999, followed by a pause since the turn of the century. Another paper found that Antarctica sea ice extent had slowly increased since the start of continuous satellite recordings in 1979.
This case study of the recent hyped sea ice alarm in Antarctica shows how the scientific process is torn up and ridiculous claims, often produced by computer models, are made on the flimsiest of short-term evidence and observation. Lectures on disregarding short-term variations only resume when normal, and often cyclical, trends reappear and follow inconvenient directions.
Chris Morrison is the Daily Sceptic ‚Äôs Environment Editor.

title: Deutsche Schulen: Sch√ºler-Vertreter offenbaren ‚Äûgravierende Missst√§nde"
text:
Deutsche Schulen: Sch√ºler-Vertreter offenbaren ‚Äûgravierende Missst√§nde‚Äú
Eine Sprecherin der Bundessch√ºlerkonferenz beschreibt bei Ippen.Media, woran es in Deutschlands Schulen fehlt - samt Forderungen an Kanzler Friedrich Merz.
Berlin - Am Dienstag (24. Juni) war es so weit. Die schwarz-rote Bundesregierung aus CDU/CSU und SPD hat ihren Entwurf f√ºr den Bundeshaushalt 2025 vorgelegt. Darin sind im Umfeld von Ukraine-Krieg und Russland-Aggression nicht zuletzt immense Verteidigungsausgaben zur Aufr√ºstung der Bundeswehr enthalten.
Schulen in Deutschland: Thema Bildung ging im Bundestagswahlkampf unter
Bis zu 95 Milliarden Euro sollen in die deutschen Streitkr√§fte flie√üen. Die Verteidigungspolitik war schlie√ülich auch ein zentrales Thema im Wahlkampf zur Bundestagswahl 2025. Ganz im Gegensatz zur Bildung allgemein und zu Schulen im Speziellen. Dabei wird seit Jahren √ºber eklatante Vers√§umnisse in der Ausstattung deutscher Bildungseinrichtungen berichtet.
Zum Beispiel bei ausreichend und zeitgem√§√üen digitalen Ger√§ten. Im Umfeld von Bundeshaushalt und schwarz-roten Pl√§nen f√ºr Deutschland hat die Sprecherin der Bundessch√ºlerkonferenz auf Anfrage der Frankfurter Rundschau von Ippen.Media jetzt ‚Äûgravierende Missst√§nde‚Äú benannt. Sie stellt eindringliche Forderungen an die Koalition von Bundeskanzler Friedrich Merz (CDU) und Bundesfinanzminister Lars Klingbeil (SPD).
Bildung in Deutschland: Expertin berichtet von Missst√§nden an deutschen Schulen
‚ÄûDie Missst√§nde an deutschen Schulen sind vielerorts gravierend und sie ziehen sich durch nahezu alle Bereiche: Vom akuten Lehrkr√§ftemangel, √ºber unzureichende digitale Infrastruktur bis hin zu baulichen M√§ngeln, die zum Teil gesundheitsgef√§hrdend sind. Es ist keine Ausnahme, sondern bittere Realit√§t, dass Sch√ºlerinnen und Sch√ºler in R√§umen mit Schimmelbefall, undichten Fenstern und defekten B√∂den unterrichtet werden‚Äú, erkl√§rt Tilda Skerra ‚Äì ‚ÄûWenn √ºberhaupt Lehrkr√§fte zur Verf√ºgung stehen‚Äú. Digitale Endger√§te w√ºrden ebenso fehlen wie stabiles WLAN oder zeitgem√§√üe Lernumgebungen, schildert sie.
Skerra ist Mitglied im Bundessekretariat der Bundessch√ºlerkonferenz (BSK), die sich als Vertretung von Sch√ºlerinnen und Sch√ºlern der Bildungspolitik in Deutschland annimmt. Und zwar bei Themen von √ºberregionaler Bedeutung. So sollen Anliegen von Sch√ºlern und Sch√ºlerinnen bundesweit Geh√∂r verschafft werden, w√§hrend f√ºr das Thema Bildung im deutschen F√∂deralismus vorrangig die Bundesl√§nder zust√§ndig sind.
Es ist keine Ausnahme, sondern bittere Realit√§t, dass Sch√ºler*innen in R√§umen mit Schimmelbefall, undichten Fenstern und defekten B√∂den unterrichtet werden.
Die Kulturhoheit der L√§nder im Bildungsbereich ist im Grundgesetz verankert. Der Bund nimmt durch F√∂rdermittel und Subventionen, etwa bei Bauvorhaben, aber sehr wohl erheblichen Einfluss auf die Bildungspolitik und kann die L√§nder je nach Gewichtung des Themas bei der Budgetierung erheblich entlasten - oder eben nicht.
Sonderverm√∂gen der schwarz-roten Koalition: Sch√ºler-Vertreter fordern viel mehr Geld von Merz
Nach Ansicht von Skerra und ihrer Mitstreiter kommen aus Berlin zu wenige Signale und vor allem zu wenig Geld, um fr√ºhere Vers√§umnisse anzugehen und bestenfalls zu beheben. ‚ÄûWir fordern, dass mindestens zehn Prozent des geplanten Infrastruktur-Sonderverm√∂gens, also rund 50 Milliarden Euro, zweckgebunden in die Sanierung und Modernisierung von Schulen investiert werden‚Äú, erkl√§rt Skerra unserer Redaktion. ‚ÄûDar√ºber hinaus braucht es ein langfristig angelegtes F√∂rderprogramm, das die bauliche, digitale und strukturelle Weiterentwicklung unserer Schulen strategisch begleitet.‚Äú
Ferner m√ºsse der schon unter der fr√ºheren Ampel-Bundesregierung so bezeichnete ‚ÄûDigitalPakt deutlich aufgestockt und ausgebaut werden, um Bildung endlich nachhaltig im 21. Jahrhundert anzukommen zu lassen‚Äú, meint die Expertin. Zu weiteren Forderungen der Bundessch√ºlerkonferenz geh√∂rt die Sicherstellung der Finanzierung von verpflichtenden Fort- und Weiterbildungsbereichen, was etwa die Themen ‚Äûmentale Gesundheit‚Äú und ‚Äûdigitale Lehrformate‚Äú betreffe. Und ein realistischer Betreuungsschl√ºssel, wie es die BSK-Sprecherin beschreibt: ‚ÄûMindestens eine Schulsozialarbeiterin oder ein Schulsozialarbeiter auf 300 Sch√ºler*innen und auf 150 Sch√ºler*innen eine Schulpsychologin oder ein Schulpsychologe je Bundesland.‚Äú
Lars Klingbeil stellt Bundeshaushalt 2025 vor: Bildungsausgaben steigen leicht
Das alles gebe es bislang nicht. Die Investitionen in die Bildung, die Vize-Kanzler Klingbeil im Bundeshaushalt 2025 vorstellte, d√ºrften bei den Experten aus dem Bereich jedoch f√ºr √ºberschaubare Begeisterung sorgen. Laut Website des Bundesfinanzministeriums entfallen von 488,60 Milliarden Euro aus dem Regierungsentwurf gerade mal 4,57 Prozent auf die Themen Bildung und Forschung - rund 22,31 Milliarden Euro.
Das ist ein leichter Anstieg. Zum Vergleich: Die gescheiterte Ampel-Bundesregierung hatte f√ºr 2024 noch 21,49 Milliarden Euro eingeplant. Laut Bundesfinanzministerium sollen aus dem Sonderverm√∂gen zudem insgesamt 6,5 Milliarden Euro in Investitionen f√ºr die Kindertagesbetreuung und in die digitale Bildung flie√üen. In einem Zeitraum bis 2029. Von den geforderten 50 Milliarden Euro der BSK ist das weit entfernt. (pm)

title: What does 12/31/23 mean? The last day of 2023 is an angel number
text: The upcoming year will be filled with blessings, at least that is what the numerical sequence of this New Year‚Äôs Eve date suggests. If you take a closer look at the date, written as 12/31/23 or even 123123, you might see an angel number, which are repeating number sequence s, often used as a guide for deeper spiritual exploration. The numerical sequences can range anywhere from 000 to 999 , with each number having a distinct meaning and energy, USA Today previously reported. The once-in-a-century date, which won‚Äôt be seen again on our calenders until Dec. 31, 2123, marks a new beginning. One, that asks us to ‚Äútransform and evolve with the times and in the right place to embrace what is coming to us,‚Äù according to the Old Farmer‚Äôs Almanac website. The date has also sparked an online trend, with TikTok users creating videos on the significance of the number and merchandise commemorating the date selling online, including on platforms like Amazon , eBay and Etsy , the Detroit Free Press, part of the USA Today Network reported. Here‚Äôs what we know about the date. Numerology is an ancient esoteric science that deals with numbers and letters and the energy, intention and vibration behind them, professional numerologist Novalee Wilder shared with USA Today earlier this month. "Before there was even language, there were numbers," she said. "Before we had named things, we had counted them, and we had assigned meaning to that count." The numbers that make up the angel number are just as important as the whole number, especially when you are trying to determine the vibration and intention behind the number. Together, the sequence of these three numbers speaks of the spark of initiation that seeks to build a new creation.‚Äù If you add all the numbers that make up the date 123123 together, you will come up with 12. text: [TODAY](https://today.com) Valerie Bertinelli is enjoying her time with her new boyfriend, Mike Goodnough. "It was a good birthday ü•∞üòÇ‚ô•Ô∏è," she penned the caption. Read on to learn more about Valerie Bertinelli and Mike Goodnough's relationship. When did Valerie Bertinelli and Mike Goodnough reveal they were dating? In March, Bertinelli revealed that [she was ‚Äúin love‚Äù](https://www.today.com/popculture/valerie-bertinelli-dating-rcna143356) with someone whose identity she did not want to share publicly. A few weeks after that, Goodnough confirmed on his Substack called ["Hoarse Whisperings"](https://www.hoarsewhisperings.com/) that he and Bertinelli were in a relationship. ‚ÄúI am Valerie Bertinelli‚Äôs boyfriend ‚Ä¶ and that may well be among the most surreal sentences I‚Äôve ever pecked out,‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúBut it‚Äôs true‚Ä¶ and nothing about our actual relationship seems surreal. It just seems ‚Ä¶ good ‚Ä¶ lucky ‚Ä¶ a gift.‚Äù He continued by writing that ‚Äúlife is crazy, kids. It just is. It‚Äôll rain hellfire down on you for years and bring you to your knees‚Ä¶ and then it‚Äôll open the skies to deep blue and love and calling someone ‚ÄòHoney‚Äô because you just love the absolute hell out of her and feel so very thankful for the gift of that feeling, the gift of her.‚Äù ‚ÄúSo, the little rumor going around," he added, "consider it happily confirmed. I just adore her. I‚Äôm so glad we‚Äôre together.‚Äù Goodnough also told his readers he first asked the ‚ÄúHot in Cleveland‚Äù star's permission before making his big reveal. He also joked about calling Bertinelli to ask her about the ‚Äúrumors‚Äù that they were dating. ‚ÄúShe was lovely and warm and just exactly as you would imagine; and we had a humorous conversation about this whole thing,‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúI said ‚ÄòI know this is going to sound weird but‚Ä¶ there is apparently a rumor going around that you and I are‚Ä¶ romantically involved. I know. Where do they get this stuff? But it was apparently in a couple gossip mags today. Not sure if you are aware or care‚Ä¶‚Äô‚Äù As they went back and forth, joking about the tabloids, he wrote, ‚ÄúShe said ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs true. I totally am. You‚Äôre my boyfriend.‚Äô‚Äù Goodnough also posted a photo of himself with Bertinelli‚Äôs cats. Who is Valerie Bertinelli's boyfriend, Mike Goodnough? Mike Goodnough is a writer who lives on the East Coast. In his relationship reveal post, he wrote that he‚Äôs a ‚Äúguy who abruptly ‚Äòdecided to be a writer‚Äô a little over a year ago.‚Äù ‚ÄúI write a lot about life and loss and love; joy and grief; hardship, long tunnels with little light on the other side ‚Ä¶ and then making it through them,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm an open book ‚Ä¶ and that often leads people to be open themselves in the comments.‚Äù He also is father to a 16-year-old son, according to his [Instagram.](https://www.instagram.com/p/C0Ak1z6JQhd/) It appeared Goodnough had been having a blast teasing his relationship with Bertinelli for a while. In a [post to his blog on April 9](https://www.hoarsewhisperings.com/p/we-interrupt-this-interrupted-telecast?utm_source=profile&utm_medium=reader2), he opened up about dating the (then) unnamed woman who visited in New York to promote her book and how proud he was of her. It was on this press tour for her book, "Enough Already," that Bertinelli revealed her new relationship. What has Valerie Bertinelli said about her boyfriend, Mike Goodnough? Prior to revealing Goodnough's identity, Bertinelli said in an interview with People that [she](https://www.today.com/popculture/valerie-bertinelli-dating-rcna143356) [ was](https://www.today.com/popculture/valerie-bertinelli-dating-rcna143356) [ ‚Äúin love.‚Äù](https://www.today.com/popculture/valerie-bertinelli-dating-rcna143356) ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a seesaw of emotions because I was adamant I was never falling in love again,‚Äù said Bertinelli, who [divorced husband Tom Vitale](https://www.today.com/popculture/tv/valerie-bertinelli-tom-vitale-officially-divorced-rcna58498) after 11 years of marriage in 2022. ‚ÄúI was supposed to die with my six cats and my dog, and very happily live the rest of my years alone ‚Äî I‚Äôm good alone,‚Äù she added. ‚ÄúMy belly is flip-flopping. This was not supposed to happen.‚Äù Bertinelli added that she and her then-anonymous boyfriend became friendly a few years ago through Instagram. ‚ÄúIt was strictly platonic but there was something about him that I connected with that felt familiar,‚Äù she said, adding that the two have a ‚Äúcrazy‚Äù comfort level. Bertinelli said the pair's relationship turned romantic earlier this year. ‚ÄúIt feels incredibly right,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI found joy first, and then a man entered my life.‚Äù It seems those feelings of love are mutual. In a [March 29 post](https://www.hoarsewhisperings.com/p/the-last-dance-monday?utm_source=profile&utm_medium=reader2) about visiting a dying friend in Los Angeles, Goodnough also seemingly alluded to being "in love" with Bertinelli. She was making dinner when I got home. It smelled delicious," he wrote. "I was so thankful for it, the care of it, the comfort from that. It was so good to eat together‚Ä¶" Goodnough ended the post by noting it was his dying friend that brought him and his new love together and promised to update readers with that story "next time." Are Valerie Bertinelli and Mike Goodnough Instagram official? Yes! While looking at the video in bed, he cringed as ‚ÄúET‚Äù said his name and then the word ‚ÄúOoof‚Äù appeared on screen. Goodnough penned the caption, ‚ÄúWelp, so much for the staying anonymous thing. So, uh, hi‚Ä¶ I guess. üëã.‚Äù In the comments, Bertinelli shared a GIF of an actor laughing.
